SEARCH
Package risk.common.entities

Klasse CountryData

java.lang.Object
risk.common.entities.CountryData
public class CountryData extends Object
Represents the data for a country in the game.

This class encapsulates all the necessary information about a country, including its name, the player who controls it, the number of units stationed there, its continent, and its neighboring countries. It provides getters and setters for each of these properties to allow for easy manipulation and retrieval of country data.

The neighbors array contains the names of adjacent countries, facilitating the implementation of game mechanics that require knowledge of geographical relationships between countries, such as attacking or moving units.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • CountryData

      public CountryData(String name, String playerName, int units, String continent, String[] neighbors)
      Constructs a new CountryData object with specified details.

      This constructor initializes a new instance of CountryData with the provided country name, player name, number of units, continent, and neighboring countries. It sets up the basic information required to represent a country in the game, including who controls it, how many units are stationed there, which continent it belongs to, and its adjacent countries.

      Parameter:
      name - the name of the country.
      playerName - the name of the player who controls the country.
      units - the number of units stationed in the country.
      continent - the continent to which the country belongs.
      neighbors - an array of names of neighboring countries.

  • Methodendetails

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the country.

      This method returns the name of the country as a String. The country name is a key identifier used throughout the game to reference and manage country-specific data and actions.

      Gibt zurück:
      The name of the country.

    • getPlayerName

      public String getPlayerName()
      Retrieves the name of the player who controls the country.

      This method returns the name of the player controlling the country as a String. The player's name is crucial for identifying which player has sovereignty over the country, impacting game decisions and actions related to the country.

      Gibt zurück:
      The name of the player controlling the country.

    • getUnits

      public int getUnits()
      Retrieves the number of units stationed in the country.

      This method returns the total number of military units currently stationed in the country. It is a crucial piece of information for making strategic decisions in the game, such as planning attacks or defenses.

      Gibt zurück:
      The total number of units stationed in the country.

    • getContinent

      public String getContinent()
      Retrieves the continent to which the country belongs.

      This method returns the name of the continent as a String. The continent is an important attribute for understanding the geographical grouping of countries within the game, affecting various game mechanics such as reinforcements and continent control bonuses.

      Gibt zurück:
      The name of the continent.

    • getNeighbors

      public String[] getNeighbors()
      Retrieves the neighboring countries of this country.

      This method returns an array of String objects representing the names of neighboring countries. Neighboring countries are those that are directly adjacent to this country, allowing for potential actions such as attacks or unit movements between them in the game context.

      Gibt zurück:
      An array of names of neighboring countries.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the country.

      This method updates the name of the country to the specified String. The country name is a fundamental identifier used throughout the game to reference and manage country-specific data and actions.

      Parameter:
      name - The new name of the country.

    • setPlayerName

      public void setPlayerName(String playerName)
      Sets the name of the player who controls the country.

      This method updates the player name associated with the country to the specified String. The player's name is essential for tracking which player has control over the country, influencing game strategies and decisions.

      Parameter:
      playerName - The new name of the player controlling the country.

    • setUnits

      public void setUnits(int units)
      Sets the number of units stationed in the country.

      This method updates the total number of military units currently stationed in the country to the specified value. It is essential for reflecting changes in military strength due to game events such as battles, reinforcements, or unit movements.

      Parameter:
      units - The new total number of units stationed in the country.

    • setContinent

      public void setContinent(String continent)
      Sets the continent to which the country belongs.

      This method updates the continent associated with the country to the specified String. The continent is a crucial attribute for categorizing countries within the game, influencing game mechanics such as strategic positioning and continent control bonuses.

      Parameter:
      continent - The new continent of the country.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this CountryData instance.

      This method constructs a comprehensive string that includes the country's name, the player's name who controls the country, the number of units stationed in the country, the continent to which the country belongs, and a list of neighboring countries. It is primarily used for debugging and logging purposes to provide a quick overview of the country's current state.

      Setzt außer Kraft:
      toString in Klasse Object
      Gibt zurück:
      A string representation of the country's data, including name, controlling player, unit count, continent, and neighbors.
